message:
Hi, I want to do an async version of the method "DirectoryCopy" taken from this link for my .net web application:  
[https://msdn.microsoft.com/...](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb762914(v=vs.110).aspx "https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb762914(v=vs.110).aspx")

The problem is there are no async implementations in the .net framework for those operations(at least I didn't find them). Is it fair to wrap it around with Task.Run even if it results into a “fake-asynchronous method” as you call them ?  
await Task.Run(() => { DirectoryCopy(); }).ConfigureAwait(false);

Should I still named it "DirectoryCopyAsync" if I do it that way? Considering I am blocking another thread.
